metadata.title: CVE-2021-47009 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:KEYS: trusted: Fix memory leak on object tdTwo error return paths are neglecting to free allocated object td,causing a memory leak. Fix this by returning via the error returnpath that securely kfree's td.Fixes clang scan-build warning:security/keys/trusted-keys/trusted_tpm1.c:496:10: warning: Potentialmemory leak [unix.Malloc]

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
